channel.title: Cache help
channel.description:
Okay so I have a friend who is going to teach me how to code and everything in that nature. I am used to 317s..etc but every time I try and use a source *ExtremeKO* for example, it keeps telling me the cache is not there and it is. I will be using this source so I can learn to code / see if people like the updates I do.
http://gyazo.com/8a9db2562727cdc50aadd06eeb3a6534 -Showing i have it in the right place *so I've been told too*
http://gyazo.com/acc9f79bf322639243d39e8f1902995b -showing the error
and I am going to change the name and try to add stuff to the server *not going to leech* so I hope you can help me if not it's cool so yeah :)

item.title: Cache help
item.dc:creator: @krazyninja krazyninja
item.description:
@krazyninja wrote:

[quote=“The Web Guy, post:3, topic:544221”][quote author=nervo link=topic=663102.msg4431669#msg4431669 date=1403525291]
Yo man you have to have the cache in your c: drive.
[/quote]
Hey like I understand but i think I did that, anyway you or him could kinda show me? feels really stupid
Not necessarily. You can put your cache wherever, as long as your client is reading it from that location.

@OP: Post your signlink.java[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Cache help
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

nervo:

Yo man you have to have the cache in your c: drive.

Not necessarily. You can put your cache wherever, as long as your client is reading it from that location.

@OP: Post your signlink.java

Read full topic
